summary: Is there an option to password protect pages on micro.blog ? Haven't tested it yet, but would be a req for me ... thanks!

summary: Nope! That would need to be done by the platform, unfortunately. I can’t add that functionality externally without some pretty crazy tricks.

summary: @cleverdevil I’m using both your photo and on this day code and they’re great. It follows along post types but I’ve thought it would be good if long form (titled) posts could be seen separately.

summary: @cleverdevil I have a request. Sometimes we get comversations with 20-30 comments. I'd like to be able to single out just one of those comments and reply to it, such that someone could see my reply, then click on something to see exactly which comment I was replying to. Now, you can only see that I replied to one of the 20-30 comments in the thread.

content.html: @cleverdevil I have a request. Sometimes we get comversations with 20-30 comments. I'd like to be able to single out just one of those comments and reply to it, such that someone could see my reply, then click on something to see exactly which comment I was replying to. Now, you can only see that I replied to one of the 20-30 comments in the thread.
content.value: @cleverdevil I have a request. Sometimes we get comversations with 20-30 comments. I'd like to be able to single out just one of those comments and reply to it, such that someone could see my reply, then click on something to see exactly which comment I was replying to. Now, you can only see that I replied to one of the 20-30 comments in the thread.

summary:
@cleverdevil been thinking about other ideas that I think would work within your parameters ... I suspect some of my wishes aren’t possible without manton changes ... like multiple photos, so here are a couple. 
1 ... Combine on this day with photos .... 
These are the images from this year / month ... for some really big libraries people could then essentially build an archive on their site on seperate pages 
2 ... Similar photo offer for podcasts ... so any and all of your podcasts could be pulled out and displayed on their own page
